channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: And dealing with the weight of water.
item.title: Sacrifice, South Coast style

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: The Saints entered Monday night's Gabba clash with Geelong as the higher-ranked side but by evening's end, the premiership bona fides of Brett Ratten's side had taken a colossal hit.
item.title: Reality bites for Saints as Cats pull rank

item.dc:creator: Simone Fox Koob
item.description: Victoria has 322 more confirmed coronavirus cases and 19 more people have succumbed to the illness. Meanwhile, the PM said he hoped COVID restrictions, including border closures, would be resolved by Christmas, but now doubts they will.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: 19 die, 322 infected on Victoria's deadliest day; NSW schools close after positive cases

item.dc:creator: Sumeyya Ilanbey
item.description: Nineteen Victorians have died of coronavirus in the past day, in the state's biggest daily death toll. There were 322 new cases recorded.
item.title: No 'magic number' to decide when restrictions ease, as Victoria records 322 new cases and 19 deaths

item.dc:creator: Tom Decent
item.description: Interim Rugby Australia boss Rob Clarke says while everything is being done to play two matches against New Zealand on home soil, back-up plans were in place.
item.title: Four Bledisloe Cup matches in New Zealand a possibility

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: Dragons chief executive Ryan Webb confirmed the club would discussÂ the coach next week, but said a decision had not been made.
item.title: McGregor's future back in spotlight at Dragons meeting

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: Ivan Cleary copped the same $20,000 penalty Wayne Bennett received for his COVID breach. The NRL boss explains why.
item.title: NRL boss says unfair to compare Bennett, Cleary penalties

item.dc:creator: Jon Pierik
item.description: Brad Hodge is firmly in the hunt to become Victoria's new men's cricket coach but John Buchanan has missed out on the South Australian position.
item.title: Hodge steps up but Buchanan misses out in state coaching roles

item.dc:creator: Benjamin Preiss
item.description: Two people have died in the past two days at Geelong's major outbreaks - a chicken abattoir and nursing home.
item.title: Geelong records two deaths as city's COVID-19 cases increase

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: People with higher levels of education and those born overseas are more likely to be taking substantial measures to limit the spread of the coronavirus, an ABS survey reveals.
item.title: COVID response splinters along education lines: ABS

item.dc:creator: Benjamin Preiss
item.description: Nursing students are fighting to suspend some face-to-face classes, saying they fear being exposed to coronavirus infection and feel pressured to attend campus.
item.title: Nursing students seek end to on-campus classes amid safety fears

item.dc:creator: Jake Niall
item.description: The Victorian government will have a say in the AFL's decision on the venue for this year's grand final in the likely event that it cannot be played at the MCG.
item.title: Vic government set to have grand final say

item.dc:creator: Julie Power
item.description: The Aged Care Royal Commission has received 364 submissions from the public about the pandemic, most centre on the isolation of residents separated from loved ones.
item.title: 'Damn, I am still alive': Lockdown life in aged care

item.dc:creator: Roy Masters
item.description: As we are starting to see among state governments, the "we're all in this together" message isn't written in stone.
item.title: NRL must be praised for club unity, but it's a fragile alliance

item.dc:creator: Nick Bonyhady
item.description: After a legal battle stretching for almost two years, BP employee Scott Tracey has been compensated for his unfair dismissal.
item.title: Scott was fired over a Hitler meme. Now his boss has to pay him $200,000

item.dc:creator: Kate Hedley
item.description: Under cross-examination, the complainant struggled to recall certain details from the evening in question, but maintained the indecent assault did indeed happen.
item.title: Woman 'couldn't stop crying' after Treasurer's former media adviser allegedly assaulted her

item.dc:creator: Greg Baum
item.description: Since it is just about certain the AFL finale won't be at the MCG, it should be awarded to the home of the leading team.
item.title: A grand solution to the finale

item.dc:creator: Simone Fox Koob
item.description: A 75-year-old man has been allegedly assaulted in Victoria's north-east for not wearing a face covering, even though he had a medical exemption.
item.title: Victorian man allegedly assaulted for not wearing a mask

item.dc:creator: Marta Pascual Juanola
item.description: A teenage boy accused of murdering a young Newman motherÂ will stand trial for two weeks in February, despite a push from his lawyer to bring the trial forward.
item.title: Teenager accused of Newman wheelie bin murder to face trial in February

item.description: Police beat protesters as strongman Alexander Lukashenko won a record sixth term after garnering more than 80 per cent of votes amid fraud allegations.
item.title: Belarus President claims big election victory as protests erupt

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: Premier Gladys Berejiklian has urged non-government schools and other organisations to stick to COVID-safe protocols.
item.title: Non-government schools told to stick to COVID plan as Tangara cluster swells

item.dc:creator: Nathanael Cooper
item.description: In this episode, senior culture writer Nathanael Cooper is joined by national science reporter Liam Mannix to discuss the international communities' progress in creating aÂ COVID-19 vaccine.Â
item.title: Please Explain podcast: COVID-19 vaccine development 'ticking along'

item.description: The finest photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: The best of the world in pictures

item.dc:creator: Tom Decent
item.description: Rugby Australia has unveiled what will be up for sale in its next broadcast rights package, with a State-of-Origin-like concept among the new competitions.
item.title: 'D-Day is coming': Super Eight and state series set to shake up rugby

item.dc:creator: Wendy Tuohy
item.description: As any political adviser could tell you, firing off a stream of tweets in the middle of the night is not an ideal way for senior public figures to build strategic credibility.
item.title: Set aside cynicism, Mikakos' midnight tweets reflect the sincerity we need

item.dc:creator: Jason Steger
item.description: The body faces an uncertain future after the state government rejected its application for ongoing financial support.
item.title: Writing NSW faces existential crisis after funding cut

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: A 44-year-old man has died while surfing at Collaroy beach on Monday afternoon.
item.title: Surfer, 44, dies at Collaroy Beach after being dragged under water

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: The Australian Federal Police's former deputy commissioner was stood down after allegedly letting a relative use his service pistol while hunting for kangaroos.
item.title: Former AFP deputy took service pistol to go hunting kangaroos: court

item.dc:creator: The Herald's View
item.description: More than two-thirds of Australian COVID-19 deaths to date have occurred in nursing homes. Urgent action is required to better protect our older citizens.
item.title: Action needed now to keep COVID-19 out of aged care

item.dc:creator: Anna Patty
item.description: The peak body for the not-for-profit hospital network, Catholic Health Australia, says national stocks of hospital-grade masks need to be preserved.
item.title: Hospitals urge retailers to stop selling high-grade masks to public

item.dc:creator: Sarah Danckert
item.description: The former ASX-listed director says she is looking forward to resuming her life in corporate Australia.
item.title: Former AMP chairman says culture long an issue at wealth manager

item.dc:creator: Simone Fox Koob
item.description: Natasha Herbert has some tips for those attempting their first ocean swim in the depths of Melbourne's winter: breathe deeply, walk slowly and bring a thermos.
item.title: 'The ocean is saving me': How Natasha's daily swim keeps her sane

item.dc:creator: Sally Rawsthorne
item.description: Dan Wyllie, 50, will face court this week charged over an alleged assault on Shannon Murphy
item.title: Love My Way actor charged with assaulting director wife

item.description: He hasn't raced since the middle of October but former promising youngster Dresden Green looks set to make a winning return.
item.title: Gelding finally gets green light after hitting brakes

item.description: Everything you need to know to pick a winner on a seven-race card.
item.title: Race-by-race tips and preview for Gosford on Tuesday

item.description: The eruption of Mount Sinabung on the island of Sumatra comes after more than a year of inactivity and was the second since Saturday.
item.title: Indonesia volcano spews huge ash cloud in second eruption in three days

item.description: This week on the Real Footy podcast, Michael Gleeson, Jake Niall and Caroline Wilson discuss how the Tigers have handled off-field issues.
item.title: Real Footy podcast: Is there a pattern emerging at Richmond?

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: Channel Seven head of sport Lewis Martin has not put a line through the prospect of a night-time Cox Plate despite Moonee Valley Racing Club's preference for a 5pm race.
item.title: Seven boss sees romance in Cox Plate under lights

item.description: The area received close to 400mm of rain during the event on Monday
item.title: Worst flood in decades swamps parts of the South Coast

item.dc:creator: Eryk Bagshaw
item.description: Taiwan and the US have kicked off the highest-level meetings between the two governments in decades amid intensifying geopolitical tensions with China.Â
item.title: US makes history in Taiwan as 'avenues for peaceful unification evaporate'

item.dc:creator: Rob Harris
item.description: The crossbench senator has blindsidedÂ Centre Alliance colleagues by walking out of the party almost three years after he was gifted a plum Parliament seat.
item.title: Rex Patrick quits Centre Alliance to sit as independent

item.dc:creator: Rachel Eddie
item.description: The federal government initially gave Abbotsford locals just two days' notice of the planned closure in May, with the nearest centre six kilometres away in South Melbourne.
item.title: 'State of purgatory': Centrelink office in Abbotsford given six-month lifeline

item.dc:creator: Sally Rawsthorne
item.description: Ratu Nanovo, 19, is alleged to have stabbed an opponent and two spectators at an under 20s match on Sunday and is due to face court on Tuesday.
item.title: Former Fiji player 'main offender' in junior league stabbing: police

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison insists his government is cooperating with the Ruby Princess inquiry despite rejecting requests for border officials to appear.
item.title: Federal officials shielded from Ruby Princess inquiry

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: Property giant GPT says the death of the office is an exaggeration despite revealing a $519 million first-half loss and slump in rental collection from mall tenants.
item.title: 'Death of office exaggerated': Property giant GPT confident on workers' return

item.dc:creator: Jennifer Duke
item.description: Australia's biggest private employer group has warned more jobs will be lost in Victoria's critical retail sector if the dole is cut back before Christmas.
item.title: Retail groups warn cutting back JobSeeker could hit employment

item.dc:creator: Nathan Hondros
item.description: Fremantle Port could be consigned to the dustbin of history by 2032 under an option being considered by the state government.
item.title: Fremantle Port could close by 2032 as McGowan inches closer to new Kwinana harbour

item.description: From being smuggled from the mainland on a fishing boat at the age of 12, to founding the Giordano empire and Apple Daily, there was no stopping Lai.
item.title: Who is Jimmy Lai, the media tycoon arrested in Hong Kong?

item.dc:creator: Michael Lynch
item.description: Melbourne City can finish second and qualify for the Asian Champions League if they beat Adelaide United on Tuesday but they will be without captain Scott Jamieson.
item.title: City poised for best ever season if they beat Reds

item.dc:creator: Darren Gray
item.description: Rail freight operator Aurizon has beaten market expectations to deliver a full year underlying profit of $531 million and announced a new $300 million buyback.
item.title: Aurizon delivers profit and dividend jump, but forecasts a softer half
